summary: The Export-Import Bank of the United States helps U.S. companies that want to sell to foreign buyers but can’t get private financing. According to the Bank, its programs support tens of thousands of U.S. jobs annually. However, the Bank is backed by the U.S. government—so taxpayers could be responsible for losses. title: Export-Import Bank: The Bank Needs to Continue to Improve Fraud Risk Management
